subject: Re: [junit] Failing multiple times in one test
msgSnippet: ... OOoooh! TestResults! I never used those. I ll read up on them. Thanks! L -- Laurent Duperval  If a cow laughed, would
messageBody:
On 4 Sep, Shane Celis wrote:
> Having multiple failures per test allows me to provide much more
> detailed reports. In my environment, running each test is very
> expensive, so I want to get the most out of it as possible. If the
> assertion failure means the rest of my assertions aren't run, I'm
> missing a lot of information. Initially, I broke them all up into
> separate tests, but that proved to be clumsy, so I modified the code to
> allow for multiple failures (basically, a failed assertion wouldn't
> throw an exception, it would simply be added to the TestResults
> failures), and writing the tests proved much easier and provided much
> more information than previously available.
>

OOoooh! TestResults! I never used those. I'll read up on them.

Thanks!

L

--
Laurent Duperval <mailto:lduperval@...>

If a cow laughed, would milk come out her nose?
